getDataInputStream

public java.io.DataInputStream getDataInputStream()
Get the data input stream. Messages will be read from this stream and placed on the server's inbound queue, which is shared by all clients.

Specified by:
getDataInputStream in interface IMessenger
Specified by:
getDataInputStream in class Messenger
Returns:
the data input stream

getDataOutputStream

public java.io.DataOutputStream getDataOutputStream()
Get the data output stream. Messages will be removed from the outbound queue and sent on this stream.

Specified by:
getDataOutputStream in interface IMessenger
Specified by:
getDataOutputStream in class Messenger
Returns:
the data output stream

getInboundQueue

public MessageQueue getInboundQueue()
A ReaderThread will be putting messages in this queue. It is owned by the server, and shared by all remote clients.

Specified by:
getInboundQueue in interface IMessenger
Specified by:
getInboundQueue in class Messenger
Returns:
the queue where we place inbound messages for the server to grab and process.

getOutboundQueue

public MessageQueue getOutboundQueue()
Get the queue where we place outbound messages. A WriterThread will be grabbing the messages and sending them to their destination (to the client on the other end). The server will be the object that puts message on this queue when it has one that needs to be sent to the connected client.

Specified by:
getOutboundQueue in interface IMessenger
Specified by:
getOutboundQueue in class Messenger
Returns:
the queue where we place outbound messages ready for transmission.
